page.title: 01General Description of Kelso
page.content: Kelso is a small rural town in Borders Region with a population of just under 6000 people.{Kelso Square}is famous because of its ancient cobbles and the Town Hall. The{Abbey}has been standing for centuries but now only ruins remain. The river{Tweed}runs through Kelso and the{Teviot}flows into it at the Junction Pool which is famous for its salmon fishing.{Kelso Bridge}is a small version of Waterloo Bridge in London and it has lights which, at night make beautiful reflections in the river. There is lovely{farmland {round Kelso.}Oilseed Rape which is bright yellow makes the countryside very colourful. There is a{racecourse and a{point-to-point}course for horseracing. We also have many different{clubs}for keepfit, sewing, all kinds of sports, angling, music, photography, etc. I like Kelso.
